intro: Hydrocotyle uniflora, commonly known as the silverleaf watermeal, is a small aquatic plant belonging to the Araliaceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, floating leaves that are typically divided into three or more lobes, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces tiny, white flowers that are often clustered together, and it thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments. Hydrocotyle uniflora is native to parts of Africa and is often found in ponds, ditches, and wetlands. Its rapid growth and ability to spread through fragmentation make it an effective colonizer of disturbed aquatic habitats.
